things.types

Class ThingType<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • things.types.ThingType<V>

  • public class ThingType<V>
extends Object

    One of the central classes of this framework. It describes a type, it’s name and implementing class, along with some properties like whether an object of this type needs to have a unique key across all of it’s sister-objects (of the same type).

    ThingTypes are managed in the TypeRegistry, where new types can be added via TypeRegistry.addType(ThingType). A default factory for gathering types is AnnotationTypeFactory, which uses annotations to find all types. But you can implement that anyway you like.

      Default, and only constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThingType

        public ThingType(String type,
                 Class typeClass)

        Default, and only constructor. Generates a ThingType of type and class.

        Everything else is left default (i.e. all needs* properties are ‘false’)

        Parameters:
        type - the type name
        typeClass - the class that implements this thing-type

    • Method Detail

      • convertFromString

        public Optional<V> convertFromString(String valueString)

        If this type is able to be build from String (convertsFromString(), a new object is created from the input string. Otherwise an empty Optional is returned.

      • convertToString

        public Optional<String> convertToString(V value)

        If this type is able to serialize into a String (convertsFromString() ()}, it is done here. Otherwise an empty Optional is returned.

      • convertsFromString

        public boolean convertsFromString()

        Whether this type can be constructed from a String (true) or not (false).
